1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

2.verse: To know wisdom and instruction;

3.verse: To receive the instruction of wisdom,

4.verse: To give subtilty to the simple,

5.verse: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning;

6.verse: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation;

7.verse: The fear of the LORD  is the beginning of knowledge:

8.verse: My son, hear the instruction of thy father,

9.verse: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head,

10.verse: My son, if sinners entice thee,

11.verse: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood,

12.verse: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave;

13.verse: We shall find all precious substance,

14.verse: Cast in thy lot among us;

15.verse: My son, walk not thou in the way with them;

16.verse: For their feet run to evil,

17.verse: Surely in vain the net is spread

18.verse: And they lay wait for their own blood;

19.verse: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain;

20.verse: Wisdom crieth without;

21.verse: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates:

22.verse: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity?

23.verse: Turn you at my reproof:

24.verse: Because I have called, and ye refused;

25.verse: But ye have set at nought all my counsel,

26.verse: I also will laugh at your calamity;

27.verse: When your fear cometh as desolation,

28.verse: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer;

30.verse: They would none of my counsel:

31.verse: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way,

32.verse: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them,

33.verse: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely,

1.verse: My son, if thou wilt receive my words,

2.verse: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom,

3.verse: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge,

4.verse: If thou seekest her as silver,

5.verse: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD ,

6.verse: For the LORD giveth wisdom:

7.verse: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous:

8.verse: He keepeth the paths of judgment,

9.verse: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment,

10.verse: When wisdom entereth into thine heart,

11.verse: Discretion shall preserve thee,

12.verse: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man ,

13.verse: Who leave the paths of uprightness,

14.verse: Who rejoice to do evil,

15.verse: Whose ways are crooked,

16.verse: To deliver thee from the strange woman,

17.verse: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth,

18.verse: For her house inclineth unto death,

19.verse: None that go unto her return again,

20.verse: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men ,

21.verse: For the upright shall dwell in the land,

22.verse: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth,

1.verse: My son, forget not my law;

2.verse: For length of days, and long life,

3.verse: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee:

4.verse: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding

5.verse: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart;

6.verse: In all thy ways acknowledge him,

7.verse: Be not wise in thine own eyes:

8.verse: It shall be health to thy navel,

9.verse: Honour the LORD with thy substance,

10.verse: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty,

11.verse: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD ;

12.verse: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth;

13.verse: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom,

14.verse: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver,

15.verse: She is more precious than rubies:

16.verse: Length of days is in her right hand;

17.verse: Her ways are ways of pleasantness,

18.verse: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her:

19.verse: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth;

20.verse: By his knowledge the depths are broken up,

21.verse: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes:

22.verse: So shall they be life unto thy soul,

23.verse: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely,

24.verse: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid:

25.verse: Be not afraid of sudden fear,

26.verse: For the LORD shall be thy confidence,

27.verse: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due,

28.verse: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again,

29.verse: Devise not evil against thy neighbour,

30.verse: Strive not with a man without cause,

32.verse: For the froward is abomination to the LORD :

33.verse: The curse of the LORD  is in the house of the wicked:

1.verse: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father,

2.verse: For I give you good doctrine,

3.verse: For I was my father's son,

4.verse: He taught me also, and said unto me,

5.verse: Get wisdom, get understanding:

6.verse: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee:

7.verse: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom:

8.verse: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee:

9.verse: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace:

10.verse: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings;

11.verse: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom;

12.verse: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened;

13.verse: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go:

14.verse: Enter not into the path of the wicked,

15.verse: Avoid it, pass not by it,

16.verse: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief;

17.verse: For they eat the bread of wickedness,

18.verse: But the path of the just is as the shining light,

19.verse: The way of the wicked is as darkness:

20.verse: My son, attend to my words;

21.verse: Let them not depart from thine eyes;

22.verse: For they are life unto those that find them,

23.verse: Keep thy heart with all diligence;

24.verse: Put away from thee a froward mouth,

25.verse: Let thine eyes look right on,

26.verse: Ponder the path of thy feet,

27.verse: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left:

1.verse: My son, attend unto my wisdom,

2.verse: That thou mayest regard discretion,

3.verse: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb,

4.verse: But her end is bitter as wormwood,

5.verse: Her feet go down to death;

6.verse: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life,

7.verse: Hear me now therefore, O ye children,

8.verse: Remove thy way far from her,

9.verse: Lest thou give thine honour unto others,

10.verse: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth;

11.verse: And thou mourn at the last,

12.verse: And say, How have I hated instruction,

13.verse: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers,

14.verse: I was almost in all evil

15.verse: Drink waters out of thine own cistern,

16.verse: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad,

17.verse: Let them be only thine own,

18.verse: Let thy fountain be blessed:

19.verse: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe;

20.verse: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman,

21.verse: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD ,

22.verse: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself,

23.verse: He shall die without instruction;

1.verse: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend,

2.verse: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth,

3.verse: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself,

4.verse: Give not sleep to thine eyes,

5.verse: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter ,

6.verse: Go to the ant, thou sluggard;

7.verse: Which having no guide,

8.verse: Provideth her meat in the summer,

9.verse: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard?

10.verse: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber,

11.verse: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth,

12.verse: A naughty person, a wicked man,

13.verse: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet,

14.verse: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually;

15.verse: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly;

16.verse: These six things doth the LORD hate:

17.verse: A proud look, a lying tongue,

18.verse: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations,

19.verse: A false witness that speaketh lies,

20.verse: My son, keep thy father's commandment,

21.verse: Bind them continually upon thine heart,

22.verse: When thou goest, it shall lead thee;

23.verse: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light;

24.verse: To keep thee from the evil woman,

25.verse: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart;

26.verse: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread:

27.verse: Can a man take fire in his bosom,

28.verse: Can one go upon hot coals,

29.verse: So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife;

30.verse: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal

31.verse: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold;

32.verse: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding:

33.verse: A wound and dishonour shall he get;

34.verse: For jealousy is the rage of a man:

35.verse: He will not regard any ransom;

1.verse: My son, keep my words,

2.verse: Keep my commandments, and live;

3.verse: Bind them upon thy fingers,

4.verse: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister;

5.verse: That they may keep thee from the strange woman,

6.verse: For at the window of my house

7.verse: And beheld among the simple ones,

8.verse: Passing through the street near her corner;

9.verse: In the twilight, in the evening,

10.verse: And, behold, there met him a woman

11.verse: (She is loud and stubborn;

12.verse: Now is she without, now in the streets,

13.verse: So she caught him, and kissed him,

14.verse: I have peace offerings with me;

15.verse: Therefore came I forth to meet thee,

16.verse: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry,

17.verse: I have perfumed my bed

18.verse: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning:

19.verse: For the goodman is not at home,

20.verse: He hath taken a bag of money with him,

21.verse: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield,

22.verse: He goeth after her straightway,

23.verse: Till a dart strike through his liver;

24.verse: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children,

25.verse: Let not thine heart decline to her ways,

26.verse: For she hath cast down many wounded:

27.verse: Her house is the way to hell,

1.verse: Doth not wisdom cry?

2.verse: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way

3.verse: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city,

4.verse: Unto you, O men, I call;

5.verse: O ye simple, understand wisdom:

6.verse: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things;

7.verse: For my mouth shall speak truth;

8.verse: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness;

9.verse: They are all plain to him that understandeth,

10.verse: Receive my instruction, and not silver;

11.verse: For wisdom is better than rubies;

12.verse: I wisdom dwell with prudence,

13.verse: The fear of the LORD  is to hate evil:

14.verse: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom:

15.verse: By me kings reign,

16.verse: By me princes rule,

17.verse: I love them that love me;

18.verse: Riches and honour are with me;

19.verse: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold;

20.verse: I lead in the way of righteousness,

21.verse: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance;

22.verse: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way,

23.verse: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning,

24.verse: When there were no depths, I was brought forth;

25.verse: Before the mountains were settled,

26.verse: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields,

27.verse: When he prepared the heavens, I was there:

28.verse: When he established the clouds above:

29.verse: When he gave to the sea his decree,

30.verse: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him:

31.verse: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth;

32.verse: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children:

34.verse: Blessed is the man that heareth me,

35.verse: For whoso findeth me findeth life,

36.verse: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul:

1.verse: Wisdom hath builded her house,

2.verse: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine;

3.verse: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth

4.verse: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither:

5.verse: Come, eat of my bread,

6.verse: Forsake the foolish, and live;

7.verse: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame:

8.verse: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee:

9.verse: Give instruction to a wise man , and he will be yet wiser:

10.verse: The fear of the LORD  is the beginning of wisdom:

11.verse: For by me thy days shall be multiplied,

12.verse: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself:

13.verse: A foolish woman is clamorous:

14.verse: For she sitteth at the door of her house,

15.verse: To call passengers

16.verse: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither:

17.verse: Stolen waters are sweet,

18.verse: But he knoweth not that the dead are there;

1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon.

2.verse: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing:

3.verse: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish:

4.verse: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand:

5.verse: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son:

6.verse: Blessings are upon the head of the just:

7.verse: The memory of the just is blessed:

8.verse: The wise in heart will receive commandments:

9.verse: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely:

10.verse: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow:

11.verse: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life:

12.verse: Hatred stirreth up strifes:

13.verse: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found:

14.verse: Wise men lay up knowledge:

15.verse: The rich man's wealth is his strong city:

16.verse: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life:

17.verse: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction:

18.verse: He that hideth hatred with lying lips,

19.verse: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin:

20.verse: The tongue of the just is as choice silver:

21.verse: The lips of the righteous feed many:

22.verse: The blessing of the LORD , it maketh rich,

23.verse: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief:

24.verse: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him:

25.verse: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more:

26.verse: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes,

27.verse: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days:

28.verse: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness:

29.verse: The way of the LORD  is strength to the upright:

30.verse: The righteous shall never be removed:

31.verse: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom:

32.verse: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable:

1.verse: A false balance is abomination to the LORD :

2.verse: When pride cometh, then cometh shame:

3.verse: The integrity of the upright shall guide them:

4.verse: Riches profit not in the day of wrath:

5.verse: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way:

6.verse: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them:

7.verse: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish:

8.verse: The righteous is delivered out of trouble,

9.verse: An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour:

10.verse: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth:

11.verse: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted:

12.verse: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour:

13.verse: A talebearer revealeth secrets:

14.verse: Where no counsel is , the people fall:

15.verse: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it:

16.verse: A gracious woman retaineth honour:

17.verse: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul:

18.verse: The wicked worketh a deceitful work:

19.verse: As righteousness tendeth to life:

20.verse: They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD :

21.verse: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished:

22.verse: As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout,

23.verse: The desire of the righteous is only good:

24.verse: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth;

25.verse: The liberal soul shall be made fat:

26.verse: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him:

27.verse: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour:

28.verse: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall:

29.verse: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind:

30.verse: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life;

31.verse: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth:

1.verse: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge:

2.verse: A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD :

3.verse: A man shall not be established by wickedness:

4.verse: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband:

5.verse: The thoughts of the righteous are right:

6.verse: The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood:

7.verse: The wicked are overthrown, and are not:

8.verse: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom:

9.verse: He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better

10.verse: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast:

11.verse: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread:

12.verse: The wicked desireth the net of evil men:

13.verse: The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips:

14.verse: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth:

15.verse: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes:

16.verse: A fool's wrath is presently known:

17.verse: He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness:

18.verse: There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword:

19.verse: The lip of truth shall be established for ever:

20.verse: Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil:

21.verse: There shall no evil happen to the just:

22.verse: Lying lips are abomination to the LORD :

23.verse: A prudent man concealeth knowledge:

24.verse: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule:

25.verse: Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop:

26.verse: The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour:

27.verse: The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting:

28.verse: In the way of righteousness is life;

1.verse: A wise son heareth his father's instruction:

2.verse: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth:

3.verse: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life:

4.verse: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing:

5.verse: A righteous man hateth lying:

6.verse: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way:

7.verse: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing:

8.verse: The ransom of a man's life are his riches:

9.verse: The light of the righteous rejoiceth:

10.verse: Only by pride cometh contention:

11.verse: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished:

12.verse: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick:

13.verse: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed:

14.verse: The law of the wise is a fountain of life,

15.verse: Good understanding giveth favour:

16.verse: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge:

17.verse: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief:

18.verse: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction:

19.verse: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul:

20.verse: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise:

21.verse: Evil pursueth sinners:

22.verse: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children's children:

23.verse: Much food is in the tillage of the poor:

24.verse: He that spareth his rod hateth his son:

25.verse: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul:

1.verse: Every wise woman buildeth her house:

2.verse: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD :

3.verse: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride:

4.verse: Where no oxen are , the crib is clean:

5.verse: A faithful witness will not lie:

6.verse: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not:

7.verse: Go from the presence of a foolish man,

8.verse: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way:

9.verse: Fools make a mock at sin:

10.verse: The heart knoweth his own bitterness;

11.verse: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown:

12.verse: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man,

13.verse: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful;

14.verse: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways:

15.verse: The simple believeth every word:

16.verse: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil:

17.verse: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly:

18.verse: The simple inherit folly:

19.verse: The evil bow before the good;

20.verse: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour:

21.verse: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth:

22.verse: Do they not err that devise evil?

23.verse: In all labour there is profit:

24.verse: The crown of the wise is their riches:

25.verse: A true witness delivereth souls:

26.verse: In the fear of the LORD  is strong confidence:

27.verse: The fear of the LORD  is a fountain of life,

28.verse: In the multitude of people is the king's honour:

29.verse: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding:

30.verse: A sound heart is the life of the flesh:

31.verse: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker:

32.verse: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness:

33.verse: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding:

35.verse: The king's favour is toward a wise servant:

1.verse: A soft answer turneth away wrath:

2.verse: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright:

3.verse: The eyes of the LORD  are in every place,

4.verse: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life:

5.verse: A fool despiseth his father's instruction:

6.verse: In the house of the righteous is much treasure:

7.verse: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge:

8.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD :

9.verse: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the LORD :

10.verse: Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way:

11.verse: Hell and destruction are before the LORD :

12.verse: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him:

13.verse: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance:

14.verse: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge:

15.verse: All the days of the afflicted are evil:

16.verse: Better is little with the fear of the LORD

17.verse: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is,

18.verse: A wrathful man stirreth up strife:

19.verse: The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns:

20.verse: A wise son maketh a glad father:

21.verse: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom:

22.verse: Without counsel purposes are disappointed:

23.verse: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth:

24.verse: The way of life is above to the wise,

25.verse: The LORD will destroy the house of the proud:

26.verse: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD :

27.verse: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house;

28.verse: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer:

29.verse: The LORD  is far from the wicked:

30.verse: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart:

31.verse: The ear that heareth the reproof of life

32.verse: He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul:

33.verse: The fear of the LORD  is the instruction of wisdom;

1.verse: The preparations of the heart in man,

2.verse: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes;

3.verse: Commit thy works unto the LORD ,

4.verse: The LORD hath made all things for himself:

5.verse: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD :

6.verse: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged:

7.verse: When a man's ways please the LORD ,

8.verse: Better is a little with righteousness

9.verse: A man's heart deviseth his way:

10.verse: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king:

11.verse: A just weight and balance are the LORD 's:

12.verse: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness:

13.verse: Righteous lips are the delight of kings;

14.verse: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death:

15.verse: In the light of the king's countenance is life;

16.verse: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold!

17.verse: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil:

18.verse: Pride goeth before destruction,

19.verse: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly,

20.verse: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good:

21.verse: The wise in heart shall be called prudent:

22.verse: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it:

23.verse: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth,

24.verse: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb,

25.verse: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man,

26.verse: He that laboureth laboureth for himself;

27.verse: An ungodly man diggeth up evil:

28.verse: A froward man soweth strife:

29.verse: A violent man enticeth his neighbour,

30.verse: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things:

31.verse: The hoary head is a crown of glory,

32.verse: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty;

33.verse: The lot is cast into the lap;

1.verse: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith,

2.verse: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame,

3.verse: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold:

4.verse: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips;

5.verse: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker:

6.verse: Children's children are the crown of old men;

7.verse: Excellent speech becometh not a fool:

8.verse: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it:

9.verse: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love;

10.verse: A reproof entereth more into a wise man

11.verse: An evil man seeketh only rebellion:

12.verse: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man,

13.verse: Whoso rewardeth evil for good,

14.verse: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water:

15.verse: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just,

16.verse: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom,

17.verse: A friend loveth at all times,

18.verse: A man void of understanding striketh hands,

19.verse: He loveth transgression that loveth strife:

20.verse: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good:

21.verse: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow:

22.verse: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine:

23.verse: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom

24.verse: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding;

25.verse: A foolish son is a grief to his father,

26.verse: Also to punish the just is not good,

27.verse: He that hath knowledge spareth his words:

28.verse: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise:

1.verse: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh

2.verse: A fool hath no delight in understanding,

3.verse: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt,

4.verse: The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters,

5.verse: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked,

6.verse: A fool's lips enter into contention,

7.verse: A fool's mouth is his destruction,

8.verse: The words of a talebearer are as wounds,

9.verse: He also that is slothful in his work

10.verse: The name of the LORD  is a strong tower:

11.verse: The rich man's wealth is his strong city,

12.verse: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty,

13.verse: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it ,

14.verse: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity;

15.verse: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge;

16.verse: A man's gift maketh room for him,

17.verse: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just;

18.verse: The lot causeth contentions to cease,

19.verse: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city:

20.verse: A man's belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth;

21.verse: Death and life are in the power of the tongue:

22.verse: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing ,

23.verse: The poor useth intreaties;

24.verse: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly:

1.verse: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity,

2.verse: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good;

3.verse: The foolishness of man perverteth his way:

4.verse: Wealth maketh many friends;

5.verse: A false witness shall not be unpunished,

6.verse: Many will intreat the favour of the prince:

7.verse: All the brethren of the poor do hate him:

8.verse: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul:

9.verse: A false witness shall not be unpunished,

10.verse: Delight is not seemly for a fool;

11.verse: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger;

12.verse: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion;

13.verse: A foolish son is the calamity of his father:

14.verse: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers:

15.verse: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep;

16.verse: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul;

17.verse: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD ;

18.verse: Chasten thy son while there is hope,

19.verse: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment:

20.verse: Hear counsel, and receive instruction,

21.verse: There are many devices in a man's heart;

22.verse: The desire of a man is his kindness:

23.verse: The fear of the LORD  tendeth to life:

24.verse: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom,

25.verse: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware:

26.verse: He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother,

27.verse: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction

28.verse: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment:

1.verse: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging:

2.verse: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion:

3.verse: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife:

4.verse: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold;

5.verse: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water;

6.verse: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness:

7.verse: The just man walketh in his integrity:

8.verse: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment

9.verse: Who can say, I have made my heart clean,

10.verse: Divers weights, and divers measures,

11.verse: Even a child is known by his doings,

12.verse: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye,

13.verse: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty;

14.verse: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer:

15.verse: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies:

16.verse: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger:

17.verse: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man;

18.verse: Every purpose is established by counsel:

19.verse: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets:

20.verse: Whoso curseth his father or his mother,

21.verse: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning;

22.verse: Say not thou, I will recompense evil;

23.verse: Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD ;

24.verse: Man's goings are of the LORD ;

25.verse: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy,

26.verse: A wise king scattereth the wicked,

27.verse: The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD ,

28.verse: Mercy and truth preserve the king:

29.verse: The glory of young men is their strength:

30.verse: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil:

1.verse: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD ,

2.verse: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes:

3.verse: To do justice and judgment

4.verse: An high look, and a proud heart,

5.verse: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness;

6.verse: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue

7.verse: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them;

8.verse: The way of man is froward and strange:

9.verse: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop,

10.verse: The soul of the wicked desireth evil:

11.verse: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise:

12.verse: The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked:

13.verse: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor,

14.verse: A gift in secret pacifieth anger:

15.verse: It is joy to the just to do judgment:

16.verse: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding

17.verse: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man:

18.verse: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous,

19.verse: It is better to dwell in the wilderness,

20.verse: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise;

21.verse: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy

22.verse: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty,

23.verse: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue

24.verse: Proud and haughty scorner is his name,

25.verse: The desire of the slothful killeth him;

26.verse: He coveteth greedily all the day long:

27.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination:

28.verse: A false witness shall perish:

29.verse: A wicked man hardeneth his face:

30.verse: There is no wisdom nor understanding

31.verse: The horse is prepared against the day of battle:

1.verse: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches,

2.verse: The rich and poor meet together:

3.verse: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself:

4.verse: By humility and the fear of the LORD

5.verse: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward:

6.verse: Train up a child in the way he should go:

7.verse: The rich ruleth over the poor,

8.verse: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity:

9.verse: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed;

10.verse: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out;

11.verse: He that loveth pureness of heart,

12.verse: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge,

13.verse: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without,

14.verse: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit:

15.verse: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child;

16.verse: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches ,

17.verse: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise,

18.verse: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee;

19.verse: That thy trust may be in the LORD ,

20.verse: Have not I written to thee excellent things

21.verse: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth;

22.verse: Rob not the poor, because he is poor:

23.verse: For the LORD will plead their cause,

24.verse: Make no friendship with an angry man;

25.verse: Lest thou learn his ways,

26.verse: Be not thou one of them that strike hands,

27.verse: If thou hast nothing to pay,

28.verse: Remove not the ancient landmark,

29.verse: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings;

1.verse: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler,

2.verse: And put a knife to thy throat,

3.verse: Be not desirous of his dainties:

4.verse: Labour not to be rich:

5.verse: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not?

6.verse: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye,

7.verse: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he:

8.verse: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up,

9.verse: Speak not in the ears of a fool:

10.verse: Remove not the old landmark;

11.verse: For their redeemer is mighty;

12.verse: Apply thine heart unto instruction,

13.verse: Withhold not correction from the child:

14.verse: Thou shalt beat him with the rod,

15.verse: My son, if thine heart be wise,

16.verse: Yea, my reins shall rejoice,

17.verse: Let not thine heart envy sinners:

18.verse: For surely there is an end;

19.verse: Hear thou, my son, and be wise,

20.verse: Be not among winebibbers;

21.verse: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty:

22.verse: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee,

23.verse: Buy the truth, and sell it not;

24.verse: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice:

25.verse: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad,

26.verse: My son, give me thine heart,

27.verse: For a whore is a deep ditch;

28.verse: She also lieth in wait as for a prey,

29.verse: Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow?

30.verse: They that tarry long at the wine;

31.verse: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red,

32.verse: At the last it biteth like a serpent,

33.verse: Thine eyes shall behold strange women,

34.verse: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea,

35.verse: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick;

1.verse: Be not thou envious against evil men,

2.verse: For their heart studieth destruction,

3.verse: Through wisdom is an house builded;

4.verse: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled

5.verse: A wise man is strong;

6.verse: For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war:

7.verse: Wisdom is too high for a fool:

8.verse: He that deviseth to do evil

9.verse: The thought of foolishness is sin:

10.verse: If thou faint in the day of adversity,

11.verse: If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death,

12.verse: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not;

13.verse: My son, eat thou honey, because it is good;

14.verse: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul:

15.verse: Lay not wait, O wicked man , against the dwelling of the righteous;

16.verse: For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again:

17.verse: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth,

18.verse: Lest the LORD see it , and it displease him,

19.verse: Fret not thyself because of evil men ,

20.verse: For there shall be no reward to the evil man ;

21.verse: My son, fear thou the LORD and the king:

22.verse: For their calamity shall rise suddenly;

23.verse: These things also belong to the wise.

24.verse: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous;

25.verse: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight,

26.verse: Every man shall kiss his lips

27.verse: Prepare thy work without,

28.verse: Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause;

29.verse: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me:

30.verse: I went by the field of the slothful,

31.verse: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns,

32.verse: Then I saw, and considered it well:

33.verse: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber,

34.verse: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth;

1.verse: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

2.verse: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing:

3.verse: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth,

4.verse: Take away the dross from the silver,

5.verse: Take away the wicked from before the king,

6.verse: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king,

7.verse: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither;

8.verse: Go not forth hastily to strive,

9.verse: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself ;

10.verse: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame,

11.verse: A word fitly spoken

12.verse: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold,

13.verse: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest,

14.verse: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift

15.verse: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded,

16.verse: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee,

17.verse: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house;

18.verse: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour

19.verse: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble

20.verse: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre,

21.verse: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat;

22.verse: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head,

23.verse: The north wind driveth away rain:

24.verse: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop,

25.verse: As cold waters to a thirsty soul,

26.verse: A righteous man falling down before the wicked

27.verse: It is not good to eat much honey:

28.verse: He that hath no rule over his own spirit

1.verse: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest,

2.verse: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying,

3.verse: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass,

4.verse: Answer not a fool according to his folly,

5.verse: Answer a fool according to his folly,

6.verse: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool

7.verse: The legs of the lame are not equal:

8.verse: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling,

9.verse: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard,

10.verse: The great God that formed all things

11.verse: As a dog returneth to his vomit,

12.verse: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit?

13.verse: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way;

14.verse: As the door turneth upon his hinges,

15.verse: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom;

16.verse: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit

17.verse: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him,

18.verse: As a mad man who casteth firebrands,

19.verse: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour,

20.verse: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out:

21.verse: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire;

22.verse: The words of a talebearer are as wounds,

23.verse: Burning lips and a wicked heart

24.verse: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips,

25.verse: When he speaketh fair, believe him not:

26.verse: Whose hatred is covered by deceit,

27.verse: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein:

28.verse: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it;

1.verse: Boast not thyself of to morrow;

2.verse: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth;

3.verse: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty;

4.verse: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous;

5.verse: Open rebuke is better

6.verse: Faithful are the wounds of a friend;

7.verse: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb;

8.verse: As a bird that wandereth from her nest,

9.verse: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart:

10.verse: Thine own friend, and thy father's friend, forsake not;

11.verse: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad,

12.verse: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself;

13.verse: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger,

14.verse: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning,

15.verse: A continual dropping in a very rainy day

16.verse: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind,

17.verse: Iron sharpeneth iron;

18.verse: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof:

19.verse: As in water face answereth to face,

20.verse: Hell and destruction are never full;

21.verse: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold;

22.verse: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle,

23.verse: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks,

24.verse: For riches are not for ever:

25.verse: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself,

26.verse: The lambs are for thy clothing,

27.verse: And thou shalt have goats' milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household,

1.verse: The wicked flee when no man pursueth:

2.verse: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof:

3.verse: A poor man that oppresseth the poor

4.verse: They that forsake the law praise the wicked:

5.verse: Evil men understand not judgment:

6.verse: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness,

7.verse: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son:

8.verse: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance,

9.verse: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law,

10.verse: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way,

11.verse: The rich man is wise in his own conceit;

12.verse: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory:

13.verse: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper:

14.verse: Happy is the man that feareth alway:

15.verse: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear;

16.verse: The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor:

17.verse: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person

18.verse: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved:

19.verse: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread:

20.verse: A faithful man shall abound with blessings:

21.verse: To have respect of persons is not good:

22.verse: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye,

23.verse: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour

24.verse: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression;

25.verse: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife:

26.verse: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool:

27.verse: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack:

28.verse: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves:

1.verse: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck,

2.verse: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice:

3.verse: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father:

4.verse: The king by judgment establisheth the land:

5.verse: A man that flattereth his neighbour

6.verse: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare:

7.verse: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor:

8.verse: Scornful men bring a city into a snare:

9.verse: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man,

10.verse: The bloodthirsty hate the upright:

11.verse: A fool uttereth all his mind:

12.verse: If a ruler hearken to lies,

13.verse: The poor and the deceitful man meet together:

14.verse: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor,

15.verse: The rod and reproof give wisdom:

16.verse: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth:

17.verse: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest;

18.verse: Where there is no vision, the people perish:

19.verse: A servant will not be corrected by words:

20.verse: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words?

21.verse: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child

22.verse: An angry man stirreth up strife,

23.verse: A man's pride shall bring him low:

24.verse: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul:

25.verse: The fear of man bringeth a snare:

26.verse: Many seek the ruler's favour;

27.verse: An unjust man is an abomination to the just:

1.verse: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy:

2.verse: Surely I am more brutish than any man,

3.verse: I neither learned wisdom,

4.verse: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended?

5.verse: Every word of God is pure:

6.verse: Add thou not unto his words,

7.verse: Two things have I required of thee;

8.verse: Remove far from me vanity and lies:

9.verse: Lest I be full, and deny thee , and say,

10.verse: Accuse not a servant unto his master,

11.verse: There is a generation that curseth their father,

12.verse: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes,

13.verse: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes!

14.verse: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives,

15.verse: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying , Give, give.

16.verse: The grave; and the barren womb;

17.verse: The eye that mocketh at his father,

18.verse: There be three things which are too wonderful for me,

19.verse: The way of an eagle in the air;

20.verse: Such is the way of an adulterous woman;

21.verse: For three things the earth is disquieted,

22.verse: For a servant when he reigneth;

23.verse: For an odious woman when she is married;

24.verse: There be four things which are little upon the earth,

25.verse: The ants are a people not strong,

26.verse: The conies are but a feeble folk,

27.verse: The locusts have no king,

28.verse: The spider taketh hold with her hands,

29.verse: There be three things which go well,

30.verse: A lion which is strongest among beasts,

31.verse: An greyhound; an he goat also;

32.verse: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself,

33.verse: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter,

1.verse: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

2.verse: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb?

3.verse: Give not thy strength unto women,

4.verse: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine;

5.verse: Lest they drink, and forget the law,

6.verse: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish,

7.verse: Let him drink, and forget his poverty,

8.verse: Open thy mouth for the dumb

9.verse: Open thy mouth, judge righteously,

10.verse: Who can find a virtuous woman?

11.verse: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her,

12.verse: She will do him good and not evil

13.verse: She seeketh wool, and flax,

14.verse: She is like the merchants' ships;

15.verse: She riseth also while it is yet night,

16.verse: She considereth a field, and buyeth it:

17.verse: She girdeth her loins with strength,

18.verse: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good:

19.verse: She layeth her hands to the spindle,

20.verse: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor;

21.verse: She is not afraid of the snow for her household:

22.verse: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry;

23.verse: Her husband is known in the gates,

24.verse: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it ;

25.verse: Strength and honour are her clothing;

26.verse: She openeth her mouth with wisdom;

27.verse: She looketh well to the ways of her household,

28.verse: Her children arise up, and call her blessed;

30.verse: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain:

31.verse: Give her of the fruit of her hands;
